data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: How Computers Work
data.description: Introduction to digital computer and communication systems. Capabilities and limitations of information technology. Representing information in digital form. Overview of computer organization, internet, operating systems, software. Human-computer interaction and social impact.

instructors.name: Katie Anne Salen
instructors.title: Professor and Vice Chair for Informatics Graduate Affairs

instructors.name: Virginia W Jackson
instructors.title: Professor and Chair in Rhetoric and Communication

dependencies.title: Designing for the Internet of Things

data.restriction: May not be taken for credit after I&C SCI 31, I&C SCI 32, I&CSCI H32, I&C SCI 51, I&C SCI 105, or IN4MATX 43

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Digital Information Systems
data.description: Design and analysis of digital information systems. Covers underlying database and network technology, and software engineering principles used to build these systems. Evaluating digital information systems, and recognizing common flaws and vulnerabilities.
data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 10 or I&C SCI 21 or CSE 21 or I&C SCI H21 or IN4MATX 41. I&C SCI 10 with a grade of C or better. I&C SCI 21 with a grade of C or better. CSE 21 with a grade of C or better. I&C SCI H21 with a grade of C or better. IN4MATX 41 with a grade of C or better

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: The Internet and Public Policy
data.description: How the Internet works. Current public policy issues concerning the Internet. Introductory economics. Communications law. Interactions between information technology, economics, and law. Case studies about Internet and communications policy.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Artificial Intelligence and Society
data.description: Investigates AI technologies and their impacts at individual, group, and societal levels. Topics include digital inclusion, bias, employment, governance, ethics, privacy, and cultural implications, emphasizing equitable opportunities and responsible AI development.
data.restriction: Undergraduate ONLY

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Critical Writing on Information Technology
data.description: Study and practice of critical writing and oral communication as it applies to information technology. Each student writes assignments of varying lengths, totaling at least 4,000 words.

instructors.name: Richard H Granger
instructors.title: Professor Emeritus of Computer Science and Cognitive Sciences

instructors.name: Vitor Luiz De Souza Santos
instructors.title: Assistant Professor
instructors.department: Claire Trevor School of the Arts - Dance

data.prerequisiteText: Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement
data.restriction: School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Graphics Processors and Game Platforms
data.description: Principles of computer architecture emphasizing hardware used with general purpose processor to support high-performance computer games and graphics engines.
data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 51

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Game Engine Lab
data.description: The use of an open source game or graphics engine in the design and implementation of a computer game. Principles of game engine design. Students work on teams to design, implement, and evaluate new computer games based on an engine.

instructors.name: Jonathan D Davis
instructors.title: Lecturer
instructors.department: Claire Trevor School of the Arts - Music

data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 45C or GDIM 32 or I&C SCI 167

prerequisites.title: Programming in C/C++ as a Second Language

data.restriction: School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Modeling and World Building
data.description: Use of 3D modeling software and related tools to design and create animated, textured models, and expansive virtual worlds incorporating objects, scenes, and venues for activity within game worlds and online environments.
data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 33 and (I&C SCI 6N or MATH 3A) and (I&C SCI 61 or GDIM 25)
data.restriction: School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment
data.corequisites: I&C SCI 61 and GDIM 25 may also be taken as corequisites

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Mobile and Ubiquitous Games
data.description: Design and technology of mobile games, including mixed reality gaming, urban games, and locative media. Case studies of significant systems. Uses and limitations of location-based technologies. Infrastructures and their relationships to gameplay and design.
data.prerequisiteText: (I&C SCI 61 or GDIM 25) and (GDIM 31 or I&C SCI 10 or I&C SCI 31 or I&C SCI H32)

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Game Design
data.description: Game design takes into consideration psychology, narrative, platform features and limitations, marketing, computer science capabilities, human-computer interface principles, industry trends, aesthetic judgment, and other factors. Students focus on video game design through lectures, readings, presentations, implementation, and play testing.

instructors.name: James Bryan Jackson
instructors.title: Continuing Lecturer
instructors.department: Claire Trevor School of the Arts - Studio Art

instructors.name: Shelby Roberts
instructors.title: Associate Professor of Teaching
instructors.department: Claire Trevor School of the Arts - Studio Art

data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 61 or GDIM 25
data.restriction: Computer Game Science majors, Game Design and Interactive Media majors, and School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment. School of ICS majors have second consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Multiplayer Game Systems
data.description: Foundations and technologies that enable multiuser, networked, and persistent virtual environments. Emphasis on database design and management, network protocols, and concurrency control to accommodate large numbers of simultaneous users.
data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 51 or GDIM 31
data.restriction: Computer Game Science majors and School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Multiplayer Game Project
data.description: Design and develop a multiplayer game using Unity or similar engine, with a focus on learning to work in a development team, writing design documents, working with platform features and limitations, developing engaging mechanics, playtesting, and post-mortems.

instructors.name: James Bryan Jackson
instructors.title: Continuing Lecturer
instructors.department: Claire Trevor School of the Arts - Studio Art

data.prerequisiteText: (GDIM 27 with a minimum grade of C or I&C SCI 166 with a minimum grade of C) and (GDIM 33 with a minimum grade of C or I&C SCI 161 with a minimum grade of C) and (GDIM 61 with a minimum grade of C or I&C SCI 62 with a minimum grade of C)
data.restriction: Computer Game Science majors and Game Design and Interactive Media majors have the first consideration for enrollment. School of ICS majors have second consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Capstone Game Project I
data.description: Students work in teams to design and implement a unique game or interactive experience. Emphasis on sound, art, and level design, building a community, production values, full utilization of hardware and software platform, and current industry trends.

instructors.name: James Bryan Jackson
instructors.title: Continuing Lecturer
instructors.department: Claire Trevor School of the Arts - Studio Art

data.prerequisiteText: GDIM 27 with a minimum grade of C or GDIM 61 with a minimum grade of C or I&C SCI 62 with a minimum grade of C or I&C SCI 166 with a minimum grade of C
data.restriction: Seniors, Computer Game Science majors, and Game Design and Interactive Media majors have the first consideration for enrollment. School of ICS majors given second right of consideration

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Capstone Game Project II
data.description: Students continue work in teams to design and implement a unique game or interactive experience. Emphasis on sound, art, and level design, building a community, production values, full utilization of hardware and software platform, and current industry trends.

instructors.name: James Bryan Jackson
instructors.title: Continuing Lecturer
instructors.department: Claire Trevor School of the Arts - Studio Art

data.prerequisiteText: GDIM 167A with a minimum grade of C or I&C SCI 169A with a minimum grade of C. In Progress grade for GDIM 167A or I&C SCI 169A also accepted
data.restriction: Seniors, Computer Game Science majors, and Game Design and Interactive Media majors have the first consideration for enrollment. School of ICS majors given second right of consideration

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Industrial or Public Sector Field Study
data.description: Students participate in an off-campus, supervised internship for a minimum of 60 hours. Students apply classroom knowledge through internship projects in the private sector or nonprofit agencies.
data.repeatability: May be taken for credit 4 times
data.restriction: Computer Science and Engineering majors and School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Tutoring in ICS
data.description: Principles and practice of providing technical assistance to novice learners in information and computer sciences.
data.repeatability: May be taken for credit for 18 units.
data.restriction: ICS Peer Tutoring Program students only.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Invitation to Computing
data.description: Foundational principles of computer science for students with no computing background that are interested in a related career. Big ideas of computing explored, including programming through use of sequential, conditional, iterative logic. Good computational practices, problem solving, and organization discussed.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Introduction to Computer Science I
data.description: Introduces fundamental concepts related to computer software design and construction. Develops initial design and programming skills using a high-level language. Fundamental concepts of control structures, data structures, and object-oriented programming.

instructors.name: Jonathan D Davis
instructors.title: Lecturer
instructors.department: Claire Trevor School of the Arts - Music

instructors.name: Kathryn Kolstad Hoffman
instructors.title: Senior Organizational Analyst
instructors.department: Sue & Bill Gross School of Nursing

dependencies.title: Honors Introduction to Computer Science II
Mathematics and Computation in the Digital Age: Introduction to Image Processing

data.restriction: CSE 21 or I&C SCI 21 may not be taken for credit if taken after IN4MATX 42.
data.overlap: I&C SCI H21, I&C SCI 31, EECS 10, EECS 12, ENGRMAE 10.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Introduction to Computer Science II
data.description: Abstract behavior of classic data structures (stacks, queues, sorted and unsorted maps), alternative implementations, analysis of time, and space efficiency.

instructors.name: Jonathan D Davis
instructors.title: Lecturer
instructors.department: Claire Trevor School of the Arts - Music

data.prerequisiteText: CSE 21 or I&C SCI 21 or I&C SCI H21. CSE 21 with a grade of C or better. I&C SCI 21 with a grade of C or better. I&C SCI H21 with a grade of C or better.

prerequisites.title: Honors Introduction to Computer Science I

dependencies.title: Honors Introduction to Computer Science III

data.overlap: I&C SCI H22, CSE 42, I&C SCI 32, CSE 43, I&C SCI 33.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Computing Technologies and Their Social Impact
data.description: Examines current computing technologies and social implications at the individual, group, and societal level. Issues include privacy, trust, identity, reputation, governance, and malicious behavior, ethics, social justice, and culture and community.

instructors.name: Skylar Mcdonald
instructors.department: Sue and Bill Gross Stem Cell Research Center

data.restriction: I&C SCI 3 may not be taken for credit after IN4MATX 161

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Introduction to Programming
data.description: Introduction to fundamental concepts and techniques for writing software in a high-level programming language. Covers the syntax and semantics of data types, expressions, exceptions, control structures, input/output, methods, classes, and pragmatics of programming.

dependencies.title: Quantitative Methods for Cognitive Sciences Research
Analysis, Modeling, and Visualization of Multidimensionnal Environmental Data
Mathematics and Computation in the Digital Age: Introduction to Signal Processing
Designing for the Internet of Things
Design of Social and Interpersonal Technologies
Mathematics and Computation in the Digital Age: Introduction to Signal Processing
Statistical Computing and Exploratory Data Analysis

data.restriction: Computer Science and Engineering majors and School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Programming with Software Libraries
data.description: Construction of programs for problems and computing environments more varied than in I&C SCI 31. Using library modules for applications such as graphics, sound, GUI, database, Web, and network programming. Language features beyond those in I&C SCI 31 are introduced as needed.
data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 31 with a minimum grade of C
data.restriction: Computer Science and Engineering majors and School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Python Programming and Libraries (Accelerated)
data.description: Introduces Python syntax and semantics for fundamental programming concepts.  Constructing programs for varied problems and environments. Using library modules for applications such as graphics, sound, GUI, database, Web, and network programming. Accelerated course for students with previous programming background.
data.prerequisiteText: AP Computer Science A. AP Computer Science A with a minimum score of 3. Placement via a transfer course in computer programming or equivalent experience may also be accepted upon review.

dependencies.title: Designing for the Internet of Things
Design of Social and Interpersonal Technologies

data.restriction: School of Info & Computer Sci students have first consideration for enrollment. Computer Science Engineering Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Intermediate Programming
data.description: Intermediate-level language features and programming concepts for larger, more complex, higher-quality software. Functional programming, name spaces, modules, class protocols, inheritance, iterators, generators, operator overloading, reflection. Analysis of time and space efficiency.
data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 32 with a minimum grade of C or I&C SCI H32 with a minimum grade of C

dependencies.title: Internet of Things (IoT) Software and Systems
Programming in C/C++ as a Second Language
Programming in Java as a Second Language

data.restriction: Computer Science and Engineering majors and School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Teaching Assistant Training Seminar
data.description: Theories, methods, and resources for teaching computer science at the university level, particularly by teaching assistants. Classroom presentations, working with individuals, grading, motivating students. Participants will give and critique presentations and may be videotaped while teaching.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Advanced Teaching Assistant Seminar
data.description: Teaching computer science at the university level, emphasizing issues in teaching an entire course. Course organization, designing examinations and projects, grading, motivating students. Participants will begin to assemble teaching portfolios.
data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 398A

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: University Teaching
data.description: Involves on-the-job experience for Teaching Assistants.

instructors.name: Richard H Granger
instructors.title: Professor Emeritus of Computer Science and Cognitive Sciences

data.repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.
data.restriction: Teaching assistants only.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Designing Computing Technology for People
data.description: Introduces students to basic principles of human-centered computing and theories of human behavior that are relevant for the design of technology for people. Specific topics include usability, prototyping, heuristic evaluation, visual design, theory of perception, accessibility.
data.restriction: I&C SCI 4 may not be taken for credit after IN4MATX 131

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Programming in C/C++ as a Second Language
data.description: An introduction to the lexical, syntactic, semantic, and pragmatic characteristics of the C/C++ languages for experienced programmers. Emphasis on object-oriented programming, using standard libraries, and programming with manual garbage collection.
data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 33 with a minimum grade of C or EECS 40 with a minimum grade of C

dependencies.title: Advanced Programming and Problem Solving with C++
Software Testing, Analysis, and Quality Assurance

data.restriction: Computer Science and Engineering majors and School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Programming in Java as a Second Language
data.description: An introduction to the lexical, syntactic, semantic, and pragmatic characteristics of the Java language for experienced programmers. Emphasis on object-oriented programming, using standard libraries, and programming with automatic garbage collection.
data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 33 with a minimum grade of C or CSE 43 with a minimum grade of C

dependencies.title: Project in Databases and Web Applications
Software Testing, Analysis, and Quality Assurance

data.restriction: Computer Science and Engineering majors and School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment. I&C SCI 45J may not be taken for credit after I&C SCI 22, I&C SCI 23, or CSE 23

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Data Structure Implementation and Analysis
data.description: Focuses on implementation and mathematical analysis of fundamental data structures and algorithms. Covers storage allocation and memory management techniques.
data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 33 with a minimum grade of C and I&C SCI 45C with a minimum grade of C

prerequisites.title: Programming in C/C++ as a Second Language

dependencies.title: Light and Geometry in Computer Vision
Software Testing, Analysis, and Quality Assurance

data.restriction: Computer Science and Engineering majors and School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Global Disruption and Information Technology
data.description: Explores how new forms of information technology may support transition to a sustainable civilization. Topics include design and implementation of IT systems, science of global change, online community building, and green IT. Activities involve reading, writing, discussion, and final project.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Introductory Computer Organization
data.description: Multilevel view, design, and operation of computer system components. Machine-level data and instruction representation. Instruction sets and addressing modes. Memory organization. Laboratory work using low-level programming languages.

instructors.name: Jonathan D Davis
instructors.title: Lecturer
instructors.department: Claire Trevor School of the Arts - Music

data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 33 and I&C SCI 6B

dependencies.title: Introduction to Embedded and Ubiquitous Systems
Introduction to Embedded and Ubiquitous Systems

data.restriction: School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Introduction to Software Engineering
data.description: Introduction to concepts, methods, and current practice of software engineering. Study of large-scale software production; software life cycle models as an organizing structure; principles and techniques appropriate for each stage of production. Laboratory work involves a project illustrating these elements.

instructors.name: David Brodbeck
instructors.title: Professor
instructors.department: Claire Trevor School of the Arts - Music

data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 23. I&C SCI 23 with a grade of C or better.

prerequisites.title: Honors Introduction to Computer Science III

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Principles in System Design
data.description: Introduces basic principles of system software: operating systems, compilers, and networking. Exposure to the following topics through theoretical and practical programming experiences: linking and loading, process and memory management, concurrency and synchronization, network communication, programming for performance, etc.
data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 46 with a minimum grade of C and I&C SCI 51 with a minimum grade of C
data.restriction: Computer Science and Engineering majors and School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Principles in System Design Laboratory
data.description: Required laboratory section and corequisite for I&C SCI 53.
data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 51
data.restriction: School of Info & Computer Sci students have first consideration for enrollment.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Games and Society
data.description: The study and critical analysis of computer games as art objects, cultural artifacts, gateways to virtual worlds, educational aids, and tools for persuasion and social change. Emphasis on understanding games in their historical and cultural context.

dependencies.title: Special Topics in Games and Society

data.restriction: Computer Game Science majors and Game Design and Interactive Media majors have the first consideration for enrollment. School of ICS majors have second right of consideration

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Game Design Fundamentals
data.description: Explore the fundamentals of game design through the design and play of simple analog game systems. Students explore the principles and usage of game design elements through hands-on projects emphasizing iteration and playtesting in a creative game design community.

instructors.name: Katie Anne Salen
instructors.title: Professor and Vice Chair for Informatics Graduate Affairs

data.restriction: Computer Game Science majors and Game Design and Interactive Media majors have the first consideration for enrollment. School of ICS majors have second right of consideration

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Game Technologies and Interactive Media
data.description: Technologies for interactive media and game design. Web-based software systems, virtual world platforms, and game engines. Emphasis is on conceptual and architectural aspects of these technologies.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Boolean Logic and Discrete Structures
data.description: Relations and their properties; Boolean algebras, formal languages; finite automata.
data.prerequisiteText: High school mathematics through trigonometry

dependencies.title: Applications of Probability in Computer Science

data.restriction: Computer Science and Engineering majors and School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science
data.description: Covers essential tools from discrete mathematics used in computer science with an emphasis on the process of abstracting computational problems and analyzing them mathematically. Topics include mathematical induction, combinatorics, and recurrence relations.

instructors.name: Pierre F Baldi
instructors.title: Distinguished Professor/Dir. Inst. for Genomics & Bioinformatics

data.prerequisiteText: Recommended: I&C SCI 6B

dependencies.title: Applications of Probability in Computer Science
Light and Geometry in Computer Vision
Introduction to Embedded and Ubiquitous Systems
Introduction to Embedded and Ubiquitous Systems

data.restriction: Computer Science and Engineering majors and School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment. Computer Engineering majors have second consideration

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Computational Linear Algebra
data.description: Matrices and linear transformations, systems of linear equations, determinants, linear vector spaces, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, orthogonal matrices, diagonalization, and least squares. Topics taught primarily from an algorithmic perspective, including computational solutions, applications, and numerical error analysis.
data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI 31 or I&C SCI H32 or AP Computer Science A with a minimum score of 3

dependencies.title: Spectroscopy and Imaging of Biological Systems
Applications of Probability in Computer Science
Artificial Intelligence in Biology and Medicine
Light and Geometry in Computer Vision
Introduction to Embedded and Ubiquitous Systems
Methods IV: Systems Analysis and Decision-Making
Introduction to Embedded and Ubiquitous Systems
Electronic and Optical Properties in Materials
Introduction to Probability and Statistics III

data.restriction: Computer Science and Engineering majors and School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Spreadsheets for Problem-Solving
data.description: Features useful tools for building, solving, analyzing, and visualizing computational models in diverse areas. Covered features include data entry and protection; numerical, logical and relational computation; displaying, highlighting, and sorting data; storing, summarizing, and querying databases; and VB scripting.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Mathematics and Computation in the Digital Age: Introduction to Signal Processing
data.description: Signals in Matlab; blurring, filtering; elements of linear algebra, statistics, optimization; blind matrix inversion; de-correlation method, stochastic gradient descent method, applications to sounds and images.
data.prerequisiteText: MATH 2B and I&C SCI 31.
data.restriction: Lower-division students only.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Mathematics and Computation in the Digital Age: Introduction to Collaborative Filtering
data.description: Basic concepts of collaborative filtering; clustering; matrix factorization and principal components analysis; regression; classification: naive Bayes classifier, decision trees, Perceptron (neural networks).
data.prerequisiteText: MATH 2B and I&C SCI 31.
data.restriction: Lower-division students only.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Mathematics and Computation in the Digital Age: Introduction to Image Processing
data.description: Image de-noising, de-blurring, low pass filtering; image segmentation and classification; Sparse representation; visualization.
data.prerequisiteText: MATH 2B and I&C SCI 31.
data.restriction: Lower-division students only.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Mathematics and Computation in the Digital Age: Intro to Game Simulation and Analysis
data.description: Combinatorial Game Theory--game classification, tree graphs, strategy analysis, Sprague Grundy functions, Bouton's Theorem; Zero-Sum and General-Sum Game Theory--pay off matrices, Minimax Theorem, Nash equilibrium; machine learning--search algorithms.
data.prerequisiteText: MATH 2B and I&C SCI 31.
data.restriction: Lower-division students only.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Practical Computer Security
data.description: Principles of practical computer security to enable students to defend themselves against malicious threats. Firewalls, anti-virus, secure setup of a wireless access point. Cryptography basics and its application. Embedded devices and related security issues.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Special Topics in Information and Computer Science
data.description: Studies in selected areas of information and computer sciences. Topics addressed vary each quarter.

instructors.name: Katie Anne Salen
instructors.title: Professor and Vice Chair for Informatics Graduate Affairs

data.prerequisiteText: Prerequisites vary
data.repeatability: May be taken unlimited times as topics vary

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Introduction to Computation for Scientists and Engineers
data.description: Introduces principles, techniques, and computational tools for quantitative approach to basic problem solving in physics and engineering. Project-based course that actively explores how programming techniques are used for solving STEM real-world problems.
data.prerequisiteText: MATH 2A (may be taken concurrently) or AP Calculus AB with a minimum score of 3 or AP Calculus BC with a minimum score of 3 or AP69 with a minimum score of 3

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: New Students Seminar
data.description: Introduces students to the Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences. Focuses on advising students making the transition to UCI, community building, and mostly surveying the technical areas within departments in ICS, via talks by faculty on their research.
data.restriction: School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Honors Seminar
data.description: An overview of computer science and selected recent trends in research. Students attend talks on current faculty research, with opportunities for discussion.
data.repeatability: May be taken for credit for 4 units
data.restriction: Campuswide Honors Collegium only. School of Information and Computer Sciences Honors students only

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Honors Introduction to Computer Science I
data.description: Introduces fundamental concepts of computer software design and construction. Develops initial design and programming skills using a high-level language. Fundamental concepts of control structures, data structures, functional and object-oriented programming. Introduces topics in computer organization and social impact of technology.

dependencies.title: Honors Introduction to Computer Science II

data.restriction: Information and Computer Science, Computer Science Engineering, and Computer Science majors only. Campuswide Honors Program students only. May not be taken for credit after IN4MATX 42.
data.overlap: I&C SCI 21, I&C SCI 31, CSE 21, EECS 10, EECS 12, ENGR 10.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Honors Introduction to Computer Science II
data.description: Abstract behavior of classic data structures (stacks, queues, sorted and unsorted maps), alternative implementations. Recursion. Mathematical analysis of time and space efficiency, program analysis and correctness, system design techniques, programming paradigms.
data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI H21 or I&C SCI 21 or CSE 21. I&C SCI H21 with a grade of B- or better. I&C SCI 21 with a grade of A or better. CSE 21 with a grade of A or better.

prerequisites.title: Honors Introduction to Computer Science I

dependencies.title: Honors Introduction to Computer Science III

data.overlap: IN4MATX 42, CSE 22, CSE 42, I&C SCI 22, I&C SCI 33, CSE 43.

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Honors Introduction to Computer Science III
data.description: Builds on ICS H22 with respect to mathematical tools and analysis. Focuses on fundamental algorithms in computer science, basic data structures for primary and secondary memory, storage allocation and management techniques, data description, and design techniques.
data.prerequisiteText: I&C SCI H22 or I&C SCI 22 or IN4MATX 42. I&C SCI H22 with a grade of B- or better. I&C SCI 22 with a grade of A or better CSE 22 with a grade of A or better. IN4MATX 42 with a grade of A or better.

prerequisites.title: Honors Introduction to Computer Science II

data.school: Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences
data.title: Python Programming and Libraries (Accelerated)
data.description: Introduces Python syntax and semantics for fundamental programming concepts. Constructing programs for varied problems and environments. Using library modules for applications such as graphics, sound, GUI, database, Web, and network programming. Accelerated course for students with previous programming background.
data.prerequisiteText: AP Computer Science A with a minimum score of 3. Placement via a transfer course in computer programming or equivalent experience may also be accepted upon review

dependencies.title: Statistical Computing and Exploratory Data Analysis

data.restriction: Computer Science and Engineering majors and School of Information and Computer Sciences students have the first consideration for enrollment
